document_data.mainbody:
'''Coran''' was a wandering [[adventurer]] and womanizing archer of dubious virtue who traveled around [[Tethyr]] and across the Realms throughout the 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. He enjoyed a second, decades-long life as a politician and wealthy man-about-town in the great metropolis of [[Baldur's Gate]].

{{Quote|I wasn't born a rich idler; I started out as a poor adventurer, like you.|Coran, the politician.}}
document_data.Description:
While most [[elves]] were slender or athletic, Coran's exuberance for luxury and excess lent his appearance a certain "pudginess". This was exceptionally apparent in his later years of life. 

He wore garish outfits that always drew even more attention to the spectacle that was himself. He decorated himself with rather stylist [[jewelry]].
document_data.Relationships:
[[File:Minsc, Coran.png|thumb|right|400px|''Coran had friends from all walks of life, including hamsters and their berserker-steeds.'']]
Some time after the end of the [[Iron Crisis]] he began a rather tumultuous relationship with the sultry [[thief]] [[Safana]]. Some time during or after this time, be became acquainted with the famed [[Rashemaar]] adventurer [[Minsc]].

Coran unknowingly fathered a [[half-elf]] child [[Namara (half-elf)|Namara]] with a young [[sorceress]] named [[Brielbara]] in [[Baldur's Gate]] after a brief fling. He also had a son named [[Krydle]], who wound up becoming a great adventurer in his own right.

As a politician, Coran had a good working relationship with Duke [[Ulder Ravengard]]. While not necessarily close, they worked together for the betterment of Baldur's Gate and were not beyond calling in favors from each other.{{Cite comic/Evil at Baldur's Gate 2|19}}
